newsitem.title: USA: Bull U.S. unit denies discrimination.
newsitem.headline: Bull U.S. unit denies discrimination.

text.p: Bull HN, a unit of the French computer giant Cie des Machines Bull, Thursday denied discriminating against older workers, a spokesman said.

"We categorically deny any kind of discrimination - age or otherwise," Bull HN spokesman Stephen Puleo said in a telephone call from the company's Billerica, Mass. headquarters. "We believe that all of our policies comply with all of the laws."

Earlier Thursday, the Massachusetts attorney general and the U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) filed suit in federal court against the software maker claiming it illegally required older, laid-off workers to forfeit their rights to pursue discrimination charges against the company in order to receive substantial severance pay and retirement packages.
"We think it's a matter of fairness. You have to sign a release in order to receive those benefits," Puleo said, adding that the firm feels "singled out because we are not a locally owned company."
Puleo said the average age of the 1,300 workers in the U.S. unit is 47 years old - one of the highest average ages in the industry.
